The Gross Margin over the last 5 quarters is as follows:

| Quarter   | Gross Margin (%) |
|-----------|------------------|
| Q1 2025   | 59.7%            |
| Q4 2024   | Data Missing     |
| Q3 2024   | 58.7%            |
| Q2 2024   | 58.1%            |
| Q1 2024   | 58.1%            |

Note: The gross margin for Q4 2024 is not available due to missing data.

### Operating Expenses (General and Administrative) for the Last 3 Fiscal Years

| Fiscal Year | Operating Expenses (G&A) in millions | Year-on-Year Change | Growth %   |
|-------------|-------------------------------------|--------------------|------------|
| 2021        | $13,510                             | -                  | -          |
| 2022        | $15,724                             | +$2,214            | +16.39%    |
| 2023        | $16,425                             | +$701              | +4.46%     |

### Summary:
- Operating expenses (G&A) increased from $13.51 billion in 2021 to $15.72 billion in 2022, a 16.39% increase.
- From 2022 to 2023, operating expenses grew by 4.46% to $16.43 billion.
- The growth rate slowed in 2023 compared to 2022, indicating possible cost control or stabilization efforts.

The Operating Efficiency Ratio (Opex รท Operating Income) for the last 3 fiscal years, using General and Administrative expenses as a proxy for Operating Expenses, is calculated as follows:  

| Fiscal Year | G&A Expenses (in millions) | Operating Income (in millions) | Operating Efficiency Ratio (G&A รท Operating Income) |  
|-------------|----------------------------|-------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------|  
| 2021        | $13,510                    | $78,714                       | 0.1717 (17.17%)                                     |  
| 2022        | $15,724                    | $74,842                       | 0.2100 (21.00%)                                     |  
| 2023        | $16,425                    | $84,293                       | 0.1948 (19.48%)                                     |  

This shows that the ratio increased from 2021 to 2022, then decreased in 2023, indicating some improvement in operating efficiency relative to G&A expenses in 2023. However, since total Operating Expenses were not available, these ratios are based on G&A expenses only and may not fully represent total operating efficiency.
